meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.a: The Geography Of Charity: Who Gives What And Why?

div.div: Ever wonder how charitable the people are who live in your state or community? It turns out that lower-income people tend to donate a much bigger share of their discretionary incomes than wealthier people do. And rich people are more generous when they live among those who aren't so rich.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NAEmel&via=Digg&text=The Geography Of Charity: Who Gives What And Why?

div.a: Video Captures Man Shot 46 Times By Police

div.div: Three days before Independence Day, Milton Hall died in a fusillade of police gunfire outside a strip mall. Only now are questions being asked.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NCsZ5B&via=Digg&text=Video Captures Man Shot 46 Times By Police

div.div: Just how dangerous is oral sex without protection?

div.a: How Eduardo Saverin Sold Facebook Ads In 2004

div.div: The knock on Facebook is often that it doesn’t have its ad strategy figured out. That might be, but the company courted advertisers pretty much from the get-go.

li.div: 1st media kit from "The Facebook" (note hilarious separation between "ivy league" & "other schools") http://t.co/UKOJQwaX via @digiday

div.a: Isaac Mizrahi To Sell Fashion Line On Living Social

div.div: As part of a larger deal with General Motors, Isaac Mizrahi will be selling a new fashion line inspired by the Chevrolet Malibu exclusively through Living Social

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PpYTp0&via=Digg&text=Isaac Mizrahi To Sell Fashion Line On Living Social

div.div: Seven years ago, when Ground Zero was just a hole in the ground and the world seemed convinced that nothing good would ever be built there, the author began the epic story of the rebuilding of downtown New York. Now, as the "Freedom Tower" reaches its full height, the inside story of boondoggles, self-dealing, common corruption, and why it's all taken so long.

li.div: Infuriating. esquire.com/features/world... So much money spent and so much delay accumulated.

div.a: 'Legitimate Rape' Rep Serves On House Science Committee

div.div: Similar to other politicians holding forth on female reproductive physiology, Rep. Todd Akin holds no health-related degrees.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PxtSx0&via=Digg&text='Legitimate Rape' Rep Serves On House Science Committee

div.div: According to the Center for Medicine in the Public Interest, about 30% of brand-name drug sales in developing countries are counterfeit.
BECAUSE WHO WANTS A DUMB PHONE?
Over 50% of American mobile customers now own smartphones.
Cellphones have already muscled onto watches’ turf as a time-telling tool. Now, some of the biggest technology companies are eyeing your wrist, too.
Capturing bolts of lighting as they streak across the night sky is a tricky process that requires a lot of patience and a love for stormy weather.

div.a: Demonic Face Interrupts Breaking Weather Report, Haunts Your Dreams

div.div: On Thursday night, severe weather rolled through the Nashville area, yet booming thunderclaps and strong winds weren’t the most terrifying things that went bump in the night.

div.a: One Millionaire's Quest To Build The Biggest Library On Earth

div.div: Since selling Alexa, Brewster Kahle has grown the Internet Archive, which he refers to as Alexandria 2.0, into a massive digital repository that has not only made copies of the internet, but has made available 200,000 e-books, 100,000 concert recordings, and some 700,000 films. All are available online for free.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SdUqb5&via=Digg&text=One Millionaire's Quest To Build The Biggest Library On Earth

div.div: The recipe dates back to the 70s, when it first appeared in Big Bird’s Busy Book. Although Cookie narrates the intro in his brand of broken English, the recipe is surprisingly thorough and precise.
